reviewText:
What a fabulous deal! Four movies for the cost of one. If you love romances- this is for you!

"Another Woman" is what inspired me to buy the set. I saw it years ago on TV and I loved it. Watching it again was well worth the cost. What an amazing movie! It's based on Another Woman (Harlequin Super Romance, No 558) by Margot Dalton and is about a woman who comes to in a hospital, with amnesia, and has to come to grips with life not knowing who she is. Her husband and sister-in-law treat her with disdain and it doesn't take her long to figure out that she might not have liked the woman she used to be. Rebuilding her relationships is a process that takes time. This beautiful movie always makes me cry too- it's a lovely tale of second chances and redemption and healing. I love all of the characters!! 5 Stars

"A Change of Place" is based on Change of Place by Tracy Sinclair. It was, by far, my favorite of the films next to "Another Woman." It was fun to watch!! And more than a romance, it was a tale of sister love and family as well. It was cleverly done- based on the concept that two twins trade places for a month. A bookish PHd art student with her famous sister who is a party animal model. When her the model needs to go to rehab, her studious sister takes her place in Paris. Sounds a little out-there but was pulled off with surprising charm. Toss in a romance between the studious sister and her stumped employer/investor and wala, a cute and winning romance. I really enjoyed it and will watch again. 4 Stars

"Treacherous Beauties" is based on Treacherous Beauties by Cheryl Emerson. This was a fairly good film and well worth watching at least once. I had a hard time accepting the premise and follow through. In this tale, a woman who is a journalist is investigating her brother's murder and insinuates herself into the lives of the family she believes may be connected or even responsible. It's pretty much a who-done-it tale with a chancy romance thrown in. The "villain" was pretty obvious immediately, however, and so the mystery wasn't too much fun. Also, the relationship between the hero and heroine seemed based more on chemistry than knowledge of each other. 3 Stars

"Broken Lullaby" is based on the Harlequin Intrigue (no 191) of the same name, by Laurel Pace. Of the four films, this was by far my least favorite. Towards the end I had to pause the movie for something and I just never went back, if that makes sense. The story was about a genealogist who is investigating her own families history. And it connects with a Faberge egg which is worth millions- thus attracting attention from people who want to get their hands on the egg first.  The problem wasn't the plot so much as the actors. Mel Harris played a stiff, plain and listless woman who was hardly agreeable or likable. The man who played her love interest just seemed immature to me and equally unlikable. The acting seemed wooden and awkward. 1 Star

Overall, two stellar movies, one pretty good one and one stinker. Not bad for $10!! I highly recommend this set. Oh and no worries about the reviewers concerned with not getting the movies- it comes with two DVDs and there is one movie on each side.

Another Woman - B+
This was a good movie but I didn't love it. Basicly this is a romance posing as a suspence story, but the suspense never really gets off the ground and the romance is nice but tempid. The heroine and hero are married but on the brink of divore, when the wife losses her memory everything changes and the husband finds himself falling back in love with her. Their romance is sweet but almost entirly based on what was and so the viewer only gets to see glimpses of their falling in love before all of sudden they both love each other again.

A Change of Place - B
Funny how a secon viewing can change things, when I first saw this movie I loved it and actually bought hte book and these movies because of it. After watching it again I couldn't remember what I liked about it. The acting which isn't really up to par with the rest of the HQ movies which is saying something. At the end of the movie in the scene that should be the big climax of the story the Rick Springfield appears to be unable to keep himself from laughing, which made what should have been an impassioned moment seem funny. The story is your typical twins switching place story, with a romance between two people that start off hating each other. I enjoyed the romance, but I didn't like how the end was resolved within about one minute.

Trecherous Beauties - A
I really enjoyed this movie. It has all the drama and passion you'd hope from a HQ story. Storyline aside this was just fun and indulgent and wonderful. Like the above the romance starts off as a hate, and yada yada yada the best movie in the set.

I have yet to watch the entire fourth movie and don't even remember it's name. What I can say is that the parts that I did see seemed very contrived. I think the difference between a good HQ movie and a bad one is that when it's good you know it's contrived but you love it, when it's bad the contrivancies just annoy you. Maybe when I see the hwole thing I'll change mind.

I am so glad to have found this collection.  I am tired of movies with foul language, blood and guts, and immoral leading characters.  I have read the Harlequin books for years, and now to be able to enjoy the movies is a real treat.  I am hoping to add to my collection very soon.
at first i was missing one dvd leaving me with half the movies but the return and replacement of the volume was quick and all four movies were in the replace volume.

There should have been two disks, only had one.  Missed two movies.  Thank you for asking.  I tried to explain to customer service - that was not easy.  This was first time I was disappointed with Amazon.  I had othered other disk, actually, quiet a few, they were all just fine.  I really enjoyed them.
This was such a good movie and I enjoy it so much I would like to get more.
Harlequin Romance books and movies are the best!!!!!
Short, but i like it

I bought this for two of the movies in it. It came with Treacherous Beauties and Broken Lullaby, but it doesn't have A Change of Place or Another Woman as the case suggests. Instead it has At the Midnight Hour and The Awakening. Disappointing.

They really need to have either individual DVDs it out it on the same side if the DVD. I just can't stand double sided DVDs since double sided DVDs just don't stand up for very long. Movies were good. Enjoyed 3 out of 4 so far.

Don't expect Academy-award level acting, but this is totally entertaining escapist fare from the '80s. I watched them with my sister up in Canada, where they must have been filmed. If you like romance novels or soap operas and appreciate having all your expectations filled--the good rewarded, the bad punished, the lovers united--you'll enjoy these films. And it will take you back, if you lived through the '80s. The casts are all recognizable, mostly from TV series.
Love Harlequin Movies
Wife loves these movies!!!
A really good bargain, with two way over the top movies, and two other at least average.

These movies are fluff, escape from the world and all the problems. I love watching these movies.
part of the series. good stories supported by good acting. Romance and intrigue in all!

Oddly enough, I don't read Harlequin books; however, I thought these movies might be entertaining.  They are.  Some aren't the best quality of plot or acting, but they make up for it in retro value.  All of the movies are from 1994.  It's fun to see the clothes and some of the actors we haven't seen in a while.

There are four movies.  The DVD picture, color and sound quality are all pretty good.

- "A Change of Place" stars Andrea Roth (Rescue Me) and Rick Springfield (General Hospital).  It's the story of a good twin/bad twin or maybe I should say sober twin/drunk twin.  At any rate, the sober twin has to fill in as a fashion model for her drunk twin who is going to rehab.  The Paris (it's really Hungary) scenery is a nice touch; the acting- not that nice.  Still, it's enjoyable.  The Parisienne groove music is what fascinates me most about the movie.

- "Broken Lullaby" stars Mel Harris (Thirty-something).  A genealogist travels to Europe to find information on her family's past.  Surprise, surprise...she meets a handsome stranger.  It is Harlequin, after all.  The scenery is great in this one.  Mel is a bit stilted but the storyline is interesting.  A superficial note:  Mel wears skorts as she's tromping through Europe...this could be the very reason Europeans think we have no fashion sense.

- "Treacherous Beauties" stars Emma Samms (General Hospital, Dynasty), Catherine Oxenberg (Dynasty) and Bruce Greenwood.  For me, this was the goofiest of the bunch.  If you enjoy your romance with a side of Velveeta, then Bruce Greenwood should be your leading man.  Oh, the humanity!  His steamy, yet oh so creepy, gaze at Emma's character is enough to make me laugh out loud.  Add to that, his strange, floppy hair and you'll find me searching for something that I can poke my own eyes out with.

- "Another Woman" stars Justine Bateman (Family Ties).  A woman wakes up in a hospital to find she remembers nothing at all from her life.  Her husband is a stranger to her, and she has no idea why he seems to dislike her.  This is probably the best of the lot.  The intrigue is good.  The acting is better in this one than the others.  Justine is very endearing as she tries to figure out who she is and what she lost in her past.

All in all, you can't beat the price for these.  If you're looking for high-quality drama, you've made a wrong turn.  But if you like Harlequin or romance or pretty scenery, watch these for a little rainy-day fun.
Great movies and I like all of them! This movie pack needs a five star rating because it has great acting talent in them and watching these movies just takes you back.
I owned all 3 versions of Harlequin Collector's sets. They are older romance movies but I do enjoy them. Worth the money.

Quite pleased with this purchase.  Would recommend it if Harlequin is your interest.  As pointed out above, the transaction had excellect packaging and it arrived as planned.  The DVD quality is excellent.

Love all these movies and Rick Springfield did a great job in movies.
money well spent for 4 good movies.
went back bought another copy for my daughter as a gift since she lives in another state .
I watched all four these feature films. I enjoyed them a lot. I read  Harlequin Romance Books. which i knew i would like the movies too. I look forward in ordering again in the future.

I remember seeing this movie years ago, I love Emma Samms as an actress, I remember her from General Hospital. This is a great who dunit movie and love story. AnnMarie(Emma Samms) is fignting her attraction to Jason(Bruce Greenwood)who is suspected of killing her brother Allen. I didn't remember Bruce Greenwood being in this movie before and I didn't realize how handsome he was and still is! I have seen him in Hollywood Homicide(love this movie) and National Treasure Book of secrets he played the President. I LOVE THIS MOVIE! I have had it now for 2 weeks and have not been able to stop looking at it. I have seen it 25 times, the last movie I remember looking at this many times when I saw it was Diamond Girl another favorite of mines by Harlequin. Treacherous Beauties is a movie worth watching over and over again.
This was a wonderful set of movies at a very reasonable cost.  They were lovely stories and I enjoyed them all.  At less than $5, I would recommend highly!

I used to read a lot of Harlequin books but there were no dvds way back then. Loved Janet Dailey books, wish some of those were made into movies. Anyways, I did like these four stories and would recommend for people who want something light with no violence.
The shows were ok. I enjoyed watching them when I wanted something on while I was knitting. Not the greatest, but definitely not the worst I've seen.
I LOVE ALL THE MOVIES ONTHIS DVD. WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO ANY ONE YOU ENJOYS READING HARLEQUIN NOVELS.LUV WATCHING MY DVD'S
I was so glad to get multiple dvd's in one set.  I love Harlequin books and was so happy to get these on dve.

This Dvd arrived sooner that I expected and it was in excellent condition for the price I love hunting Harlequin movies from the books series and this is the place to find everything and anything Harlequin I would highly recommend this item.

This is a great movie set that was very difficult to find and still be affordable.  As movies that have been on TV, yet certainly not lately, it's a great addition for my movie collection.

I remember seeing these movies on TV when it was Womens Entainment and I enjoyed them at that time.  I bought them because I wanted them for my collection.  They're still as good as they were when first viewed on television.  Of course anything with conflict, sex, and a happy ending is my kind of movie.

I don't know why I just do. its the characters that keep you glued to the movies . thanks

Not sure why the retail stores do not offer movies like this (or I just haven't seen them).  My mother love Danielle Steel and this will be one present that will make her smile.  She has everything and it is always hard to fined something that will be unique and affordable.  This was it.
The movies are fine although the first disc arrived damaged, had scratches on it that interfere with the quality of the movie.
The Harlequin movies are all very good. I enjoy watching them. They are a bit sappy but very good entertainment value for the money!!

I've now watched all 4 movies - 2 two-sided discs - and have to say they were just okay.  They are older movies but I did recognize at least 1 actor/actress in each movie.  Be aware that all contain some nudity that would have them rated R, but they do not contain the R rated language.  I hate movies that are not rated or at least have an indication of what to expect.  These movies were like watching glorified soap operas.

I guess if you like the old Harlequin romance books and don't mind the added nudity you might enjoy these.  I give them a 2 out of 5 stars.  Not impressed.
The acting was at best high school level. The stories were boring. I had forgotten how bad the fashion was in the early 90's!
Not bad for the price. I enjoyed one story in particularly. The acting on some  stories were not that great, but entertaining.

Harlequin has outdone itself. I love their books and turning those books into movies has proven to be quite enjoyable entertainment. OK so they are primarily chic flix, but full of adventure, mystery, and of course lots of romance. Nothing better any night than a good glass of wine and a Harleqin movie. Rick Springfield is dreamy and Emma Samms and Bruce Greenwood sizzle with unmistakeable chemistry. Surprisingly "Another Woman" was one of my favorites and "Broken Lullaby" was worth watching more than once. You won't go wrong with this Volume 1 of Harlequin movies.

I'm a hopeful not hopeless ... Romantic all the way!!!  These Harlequin movies fit the bill of ROMANCE!!!  Sweet, loving, caring ... makes my heart swell.  I love so many different genres, Romance is one of them.  I want everyone to be loved and in love, always!!!  I would recommend this movie.
